Here are three delicious meal ideas that incorporate many of the foods from the list above to support cognitive health:

1. Baked Salmon with Quinoa Salad and Roasted Vegetables

Ingredients:

* Salmon fillet (fatty fish)
* Olive oil
* Lemon
* Quinoa (whole grain)
* Spinach (leafy green vegetable)
* Cherry tomatoes (vegetable)
* Bell peppers (vegetable)
* Red onion (vegetable)
* Walnuts (nuts)
* Pumpkin seeds (seeds)
* Feta cheese (dairy product)
* Salt and pepper
* Balsamic vinegar

Instructions:

* Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
* Season the salmon fillet with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon. Place on a lined baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through.
* Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Let it cool.
* In a large bowl, mix the cooked quinoa, spinach, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, red onion, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, and crumbled feta cheese.
* Season the quinoa salad with salt, pepper, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar.
* Serve the baked salmon with the quinoa salad and roasted vegetables on the side.
1. Lentil and Vegetable Stir-Fry with Brown Rice

Ingredients:

* Brown rice (whole grain)
* Lentils (legumes)
* Olive oil
* Onion
* Garlic
* Ginger
* Broccoli (vegetable)
* Carrots (vegetable)
* Red bell pepper (vegetable)
* Snap peas (vegetable)
* Soy sauce
* Sesame oil
* Crushed red pepper flakes
* Cashews (nuts)
* Chia seeds (seeds)
* Green onions

Instructions:

* Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
* In a separate pot, cook lentils according to package instructions.
* Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
* Add broccoli, carrots, red bell pepper, and snap peas to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
* Add cooked lentils to the skillet and stir to combine.
* In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and crushed red pepper flakes. Pour the sauce over the lentil and vegetable mixture.
* Stir in cashews and chia seeds.
* Serve the lentil and vegetable stir-fry over brown rice, garnished with green onions.
1. Greek Salad with Grilled Chicken and Whole Grain Pita

Ingredients:

* Chicken breast (poultry)
* Olive oil
* Lemon
* Oregano
* Salt and pepper
* Romaine lettuce (leafy green vegetable)
* Cherry tomatoes (vegetable)
* Cucumber (vegetable)
* Red onion (vegetable)
* Kalamata olives
* Feta cheese (dairy product)
* Whole grain pita bread (whole grain)
* Hummus (legumes)

Instructions:

* Marinate the chicken breast in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper for at least 30 minutes.
* Preheat a grill or grill pan, and cook the marinated chicken breast until cooked through. Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice.
* In a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
* Drizzle the salad with olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, and toss to combine.
* Serve the Greek salad with sliced grilled chicken on top and whole grain pita bread on the side. Serve with a side of hummus

Here are three more delicious meal ideas that incorporate many of the foods from the list above to support cognitive health:

1. Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast with Roasted Vegetables and Quinoa

Ingredients:

* Chicken breast (poultry)
* Fresh spinach (leafy green vegetable)
* Feta cheese (dairy product)
* Olive oil
* Salt and pepper
* Garlic powder
* Quinoa (whole grain)
* Assorted vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes)
* Fresh parsley

Instructions:

* Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
* Make a horizontal cut in each chicken breast to create a pocket for the stuffing.
* In a bowl, mix together chopped fresh spinach and crumbled feta cheese.
* Stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture, then season the outside with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
* Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Sear the stuffed chicken breasts for 2-3 minutes on each side, then transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
* Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
* Toss the assorted vegetables in olive oil, salt, and pepper, and spread them out on a lined baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
* Serve the spinach and feta stuffed chicken breasts with roasted vegetables and quinoa, garnished with fresh parsley.
1. Seared Tuna with Sesame Broccoli and Brown Rice

Ingredients:

* Tuna steak (fatty fish)
* Olive oil
* Salt and pepper
* Brown rice (whole grain)
* Broccoli (vegetable)
* Soy sauce
* Sesame oil
* Honey
* Garlic
* Ginger
* Sesame seeds
* Green onions

Instructions:

* Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
* Season the tuna steak with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat, and sear the tuna for 2-3 minutes on each side (or until cooked to desired doneness). Set aside.
* In a separate skillet or wok, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and ginger, and cook until fragrant.
* Add broccoli florets to the skillet, and cook until tender but still crisp. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and a splash of sesame oil, then pour the sauce over the broccoli.
* Sprinkle sesame seeds over the broccoli and toss to combine.
* Serve the seared tuna with sesame broccoli and brown rice, garnished with green onions.
1. Lentil and Vegetable Curry with Whole Grain Naan

Ingredients:

* Red or green lentils (legumes)
* Olive oil
* Onion
* Garlic
* Ginger
* Curry powder
* Turmeric
* Cumin
* Red pepper flakes
* Canned diced tomatoes
* Coconut milk
* Carrots (vegetable)
* Green beans (vegetable)
* Red bell pepper (vegetable)
* Spinach (leafy green vegetable)
* Salt and pepper
* Fresh cilantro
* Whole grain naan (whole grain)

Instructions:

* Cook lentils according to package instructions.
* In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger, and cook until softened.
* Add curry powder, turmeric, cumin, and red pepper flakes, and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
* Stir in canned diced tomatoes and coconut milk, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
* Add chopped carrots, green beans, and red bell pepper, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
